result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Gene Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, fees, asessments and surcharges during the term of probation.
If revoked, DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or school or a combination of employent and school.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with any illegally controled substances, drug paraphernalia, drug dealers or drug houses.
No contact order with the location of the crime.  No contact order with Santana K.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  Breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: No electronic monitoring.  May be released to Day Reporting Center for treatment,vocational training and/or job placement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Gene Williams

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (42 pages) commencing 10/02/2014 by Court Reporter Francine Oclaire.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  4  1/2  years with 154 days credit, consecutive to any other sentence; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2  1/2 years.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION and EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- Serve 5 months in the House of Correction; NO electronic monitoring; Defendant may be released to the Day Reporting Center for treatment, vocational training and/or job placement
- no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause
- cooperate with any recommended programs or treatment suggested by the agent
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random Screens
- Breathalyzer tests
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with any illegally controlled substances, drug paraphernalia, drug dealers or drug houses
- Obtain/Maintain full-time employment or school or a combination of employment and school
- No Contact Order with the location of the crime
- No Contact Order with Santana K.
- No fine
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation/extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge - if not already done.
If prison sentence is served:
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Willie Gene Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Willie Gene Williams in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Willie Gene Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea and sentencing.  Br 21 in jury trial on an unrelated matter.  Joint request for adjournment granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Willie Gene Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Willie Gene Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.   Parties engaged in negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Willie Gene Williams in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Willie Gene Williams in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement  to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Santana K. or Co-Defendants Michael Nelson and Edward Martin

Defendant Willie Gene Williams in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Willie Gene Williams in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Willie Gene Williams not in court.  Steven H. Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/1/14 @ 1:00pm
